Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Captain! Don't you find mornings so relaxing?

Fields.MenuText: Narwhal, let me finish my breakfast. It's too dang early!
Yes, but it'd be better if you weren't screaming in my ear!
Of course! Mornings are my favorite time of the day.

Fields.DialogueText: Drink up, Captain, it's going to be a big day!
Well, now, let me sit down. We've got some important activities planned.
Then I bet you're excited for what's next, right?
Tell me, Narwhal, what's planned for today?
Shouldn't you know? After all, you're the captain.
Beats me.
Today's the day we're going fishing!
When did I say that?
Just a few weeks ago, remember? It was your idea! ... That is, you totally signed off on it... at least, it must have come up in conversation at some point.
*ALARM*
Well, can we talk about it later? There are Morganas on the horizon, and we don't have time to spare!
@BATTLE
So, Captain, why can't we go fishing?
Have you seen the size of this boat?
So?

Fields.MenuText: You can't go fishing. We're in the middle of a war!
Well, I don't know any way to cast a line from on top of this.
Why do you want to go fishing so badly anyhow?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, we have some time, don't we?
Hmm. We can take one of the little lifeboats, right?
Well, it's fun, Captain!
So, if we can't go fishing, what would you like to do?
Ugh, I'm sensing Morganas. Well, I guess we can prepare ourselves for the next battle...
Don't sound so disappointed, Narwhal. I thought you enjoyed fighting?
Don't get me wrong, I do. But... maybe, it's just nice to have some harmless fun every once in a little while.
I don't know if the fish would see it that way.
@BATTLE
Now you're just messing with me!
Narwhal, what's that behind your back?
Nothing.
No, I clearly see a fishing rod. Wait - two fishing rods behind your back.
No, these are... new weapons. For the battle against the Morganas.
Weapons? How do they work?
You take this long string, and attach it to a missile, and then you pull it back at the last second. So, it attacks in two ways!

Fields.MenuText: Do you expect me to believe you?
Pull the missile back. To us.
Will you be using it in the next battle?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Captain. Have I lied before?
It's... still being workshopped.
Maybe... It depends on what else those Morganas are up to.
Now, Narwhal, you really should get yourself together. We can't go fishing - we're just too busy!
You're such a letdown, Captain.
@BATTLE
Pardon me, Narwhal. I should probably apologize for being so harsh on you.
No, Captain, it was my fault for being so insistent.
Well, we can always have fun doing something else.
Maybe later. I'm going to write some letters.
To family?
And my pen pal! They're from another ship.
Oh! Well, I'm happy for you, Narwhal.
Captain, do you think we'd still be friends after the war?

Fields.MenuText: Of course.
Maybe, if we keep in touch.
I can't promise that. Who knows where our paths will lead?

Fields.DialogueText: That's great to know!
Well, I would keep in touch with you!
Oh, that's disappointing. I understand, though.
Well, you go write. But remember, Morganas aren't too far away. Be prepared to come up for air every once in a while.
I know, Captain. Let's try after these Morganas are gone. Don't want to spoil the surprise, right?
@BATTLE
Glad to see you've come up for air.
Oh, hi, Captain. Want to see something?
Sure - WHOA!
Are you okay? You nearly tripped over my fishing rods!
I'm fine. What was it you wanted me to see?
I, uhh, caught a fish!

Fields.MenuText: Wait, really? What kind?
Huh. I'm actually kind of impressed.
I thought I said not to go fishing.

Fields.DialogueText: It has fins... and scales. I don't know. It was green!
Thanks, Captain. It was actually pretty easy. And fun too!
Oh, but I didn't disturb anyone, I swear!
Well, I wouldn't be opposed to a fish dinner.
Ha! I'll have to catch a few more for that. Fighting makes a girl hungry, you know!
Well, when you put it that way I have a hard time refusing. Room for one more?
There's always room for you, Captain. Come on, sit down and I'll show you-
*ALARM*
Aww, and those Morganas are gonna spook all those tasty fish!
How to tidy up quick and get to action stations?
@BATTLE
Got a letter?
Yup! I have it right here. It's from my pen pal!
Hmm, what's that pink seal for?
Oh, nothing...

Fields.MenuText: Must be a pretty romantic letter, huh?
It must be sealed pretty well, then.
You don't have to tell me anything, Narwhal.

Fields.DialogueText: Why, Captain, are you jealous?
Oh yes, sealed with a kiss... Oh, did I say that out loud?!
Well, then why did you ask?
You're blushing, Narwhal.
Oh, my!
Just don't let it distract you on the battlefield.
@BATTLE
I won't. I'll let it inspire me!
Another letter? Ha - aren't you popular!
Well, yes, my pen pal is a very quick writer.
What's his name?
Why do you assume it's a him?
Heh, fair point. What's the name?
Ah, well, it's kind of an anonymous thing, you see.

Fields.MenuText: Anonymous? So how do you know they're real?
Well, I think keeping secrets is suspicious.
Well, that sounds very sweet, Narwhal.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I mean, they write back. That's real enough for me.
Compared to everything we say to each other, Captain, it's hardly a secret.
Thank you, Captain. You should try it too.
Well, I'm glad you found someone, I guess.
Don't worry, Captain, I'll still be here for you. After all, we're shipmates, right?
@BATTLE
Always! I wouldn't trade you for anyone against the Morganas.
Hear that, Morganas? I've got the power of friendship on my side!
Narwhal, you can't come to the meetings late all the time!
I'm sorry!
What were you doing?
I was daydreaming about, uh, stuff!

Fields.MenuText: Was this about fish?
Was this about your pen pal?
Was it about Morganas?

Fields.DialogueText: No, not fish. Although I have the strangest craving for some cod right about now.
Well, not really. It was just this idea of walking around in the fields with... someone... you know, after the war.
Well, the Morganas weren't there, because we already beat them, Captain.
Look, Narwhal, you told me you wouldn't let the recent "correspondence" affect your performance.
It's not that, I promise. I'll make it up to you - just watch me at the next battle!
@BATTLE
You've got an opportunity now. Make it count.
Hey! How's it going, Captain?
Aren't you in a delightful mood? I hear you're whistling up a storm!
Well, I've just been having a few good days, so why not whistle? It's not like I can sing, anyhow.
Well, that is true...
What's that supposed to mean?

Fields.MenuText: Uhh, nothing!
Well, you're not a good singer. I've heard it before.
Ah, what I meant to say is... that you have the whistling skills of an angel.

Fields.DialogueText: Better be nothing!
You could disagree a little bit...
Ha ha. Stop joking around, Captain. I thought angels were all about trumpets, anyway.
Now, what should we do about the next battle? Attack straight ahead, or maneuver around?
Ha! Are you trying to test me?
I thought it was warranted. You've been a little absent-minded lately, so I wanted to make sure you were at your best.
Well, it depends on our angle of approach, no? If we can't get the drop on them we circle around until we can make our move!
Right you are. Funny you should say that...
What's that?
Oh, nothing. Let's circle around. They won't know what hit them!
@BATTLE
You seem so focused on the latest letter, Narwhal.
I just can't stop reading it! They're so... amazing.

Fields.MenuText: What can they do that I can't?
Well, tell me something about them, then.
I bet they aren't telling the truth.

Fields.DialogueText: For one thing, you aren't the most poetic in your speech, Captain.
Ugh, just such a way with words, Captain. So poetic, and romantic, and gorgeous!
Hey, don't be such a negative person, Captain! You sound... envious.
At any rate, you seem hooked.
Yes... Captain, I think I'm falling for this person!
*BOOM*
Did you hear that?!
Don't spend too much time up in the clouds. We've got company here at sea!
@BATTLE
Hey, Captain, you've been really quiet lately. I feel like I've upset you.
It's nothing, Narwhal. Right now, we need to focus on the mission ahead. Morganas are coming back hard and strong.
Was it something I said? ... Was it because I went fishing again and got the line tangled up in the propeller?
You... what? We'll talk about that later, actually. No, it's just...
Spit it out!

Fields.MenuText: Why do you have to question me?
I'm just worried that you're letting your correspondence distract you.
Actually, yes, it is the fishing stuff.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm just trying to understand you, Captain.
Of course not! You really are jealous, aren't you?
Oh. Oh... Okay. Well, if it makes you happy, I'll include you. Just so we're on the same page.
Narwhal...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We don't have time for this. Look, I'll see you out on the deck next time I fish, okay?
I'm just worried about you.
Don't be, Captain. We can both make sure I don't get tangled up.
Captain, Morganas are here. Do we fight?
What? Of course we fight, Narwhal.
Right, of course.
Even if our backs are against the wall, we should never give up.
I hope you seriously believe that, Captain. You do, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: Well, maybe I am acting a little selfishly.
You know, Morganas have nothing to do with anything personal.
What? I don't understand, Narwhal.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks for acknowledging that, Captain. Maybe we can try and talk this out over some fishing...
Sigh... I shouldn't have brought anything up.
Well, then just forget it!
What do you think I've been trying to do?
It just feels so long ago since we... fished.
That's what you're concerned about? Fishing?
No, Captain, it's...
*ALARM*
Oh, these Morganas are rude!
@BATTLE
Captain! Whether you realized it or not, we took a few nasty shots from that last battle.
Check the crew and make sure we've got a head count.
I think everyone is accounted for... we just need to know what our plan for retaliation is.
Retaliation?
Yes! The Morganas can't get away with this, and we need a plan!

Fields.MenuText: We'll go right after them. Chase ‘em down.
Right now, we need to wait just a minute. Collect our crew, then see what to do next.
Narwhal, we'll let them come to us.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll plot a course! They won't get away!
Roger. I'll continue helping out the injured, Captain.
But will that work? Are you sure about this? We can't let them out of our sight!
Let's go forward with the plan. No matter what, we won't take this lying down.
@BATTLE
And we wouldn't be lying down for long, in any case. Before you know it, the--
*ALARM*
There it is. We're irresistible, aren't we?
You're not wrong, Captain...
Captain! We've sailed ahead for days now, and yet there's no sight of the Morganas.
HQ says they're retreating... or maybe changing their strategy.
But what could they be doing? We're in the middle of the ocean!
I'm not sure, Narwhal. But I've got some bad feelings about this...
Well, in any case, maybe we should take this time to relax while we can.

Fields.MenuText: You want to relax now of all times?
I can't relax with so much on my mind. I'm glad you can, though.
Yes... maybe some relaxation would be best.

Fields.DialogueText: It's just to take my mind off of the difficult problems, Captain.
Well, I just try to think of the positive! It's why I'm cheerful so often.
Yes, Captain. Just relax, go take a nap.
Well, I'm just going to go take a walk, Narwhal.
On your own?
We're all different, Captain, but I find that talking to someone helps clear my mind.
Not to open any wounds, but my pen pal helps on that front sometimes. There's no reason you can't as well.
Just to clear my mind. Unless... you wanted to come as well?
And you don't have to wait for the mail ship to get a response from me.
See how easy it is?
*ALARM*
Well, I wanted to.
Grr... once these Morganas are dealt with, I'm claiming you all to myself!
@BATTLE
All to yourself?
W-what? Oh! Um, that is... action stations!
Narwhal, you look disturbed.
Well, I'd tell you, but I'd rather not...
It's about your pen pal, isn't it? I thought so.
They want to meet me soon.

Fields.MenuText: Really?
Are you sure you want to do that?
That's great! Exciting, too.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, and they'd meet me on our ship!
Come on, Captain. I feel like you'd be more supportive, usually. And they'd come here - I obviously can't leave the ship.
Thanks, Captain! I'm glad you can look at these things more positively.
Yes, you can do what you like, Narwhal. I'm just glad it's happening on your terms.
You don't need to worry, Captain.
Just... don't get too wrapped up in the fantasy. I'd hate to see you be let down.
@BATTLE
It's been at the back of my mind, Captain... I've heard ugly things about the Morganas hijacking mail.
*ALARM*
Well, they certainly do keep in touch!
Encountered any?
Seriously? They'd go to all this trouble just to get to you?
They don't sleep. They've got lots of time to be all kinds of nasty. But I would have felt their influence from these letters. To tell you the truth, it's been a while since we've--
You know what's bothering me? The Morganas we've seen recently aren't the same as the Morganas we've been up against in the past.
What do you mean?
They're weaker, as if they were planted there for us to face. It's almost like we're part of some sort of game.
That makes no sense. Morganas wouldn't waste their own kind like that.
Is that what you really think? We've seen ones we sunk before. Who's to say they're not just using themselves as decoys?

Fields.MenuText: But why? It's not like we're getting any worse at sinking them.
Well, I think it's something we don't understand yet.
No, maybe your theory has some merit...

Fields.DialogueText: I just wish we could put one of them on the bottom for good...
If only they'd sit still for questioning... and shooting.
Well, what's next, then? Do we follow through, or stay?
Whatever their plan is, we push on ahead. We can't let difficulties stop us from what we believe in.
I don't know exactly how it's going to turn out, meeting this pen pal person. But if it makes me happy to see, well, that's okay too.
Kind of like writing to someone you've never seen, no?
How's that?
Pretty much. I don't know how this war's going to end, but I'm certainly happy to blow a few holes in a Morgana. If we keep doing that, we're in the clear.
As long as we're doing good in the world. Ready to do some more?
@BATTLE
Narwhal, are you around?
Hey, what's this? An open letter... with a pink sticker? Wait, it's to Narwhal...
Captain! You found it! Wait, don't read it!
Sorry! It was open on the ground, and I thought-
You shouldn't read my letters.
I was just thinking about what we talked about the other day. About Morganas and letters, and-
That doesn't mean you get to read this one! Haven't you ever been in love?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, Narwhal, I have.
No, Narwhal.
Well, it's hard to explain.

Fields.DialogueText: Then you know how I feel.
Then how could you understand? I mean, really!
That difficult feeling? That's how I feel.
Narwhal, if it's a security risk to the ship-
Then I'll handle it, Captain. But it's nobody's business but my own!
I'm actually trying to look out for you, Narwhal. If that person isn't really who they say they are... You could see how that would be a problem, right?
Then it's going to hurt, but let me make that mistake myself. They've already agreed to meet here, and I've got six torpedo tubes to hurt them worse if I need to.
*ALARM*
You're right, Narwhal. Let's put them to use.
@BATTLE
Let's go outside and see what the mess is all about.
Captain, look! All those Morganas.
This is going to be a big battle.
So it looks like I was right... they were leading us right here, just to defeat us.
Narwhal, we haven't been defeated yet, and we won't be now.
@BATTLE
Are you all right, Narwhal?
Satisfactory, Captain. We made it through! The Morganas are retreating.
Good.
What do we do next?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know, Narwhal.
We keep fighting, that's what.
Let's bring the fight to their turf.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope we find a way, soon. I've got a few ideas if you come over to the navigation charts with me.
Aye-aye.
Yes, Captain! I think it's time they see what we're really made of!
Let's go!
Maybe once we take the fight to them we can get some fishing in, huh?
I have been itching for another catch. You cooked up that green one pretty well.
Heh... I do try, Captain.
Let's go! Full sail ahead!
We really don't have sails, Narwhal.
It's an expression, Captain! Of course we don't have sails.
Maybe we could use some. You know, for emergencies.
If we ever need sails, we might as well just capsize. What kind of submarine would I be if I relied on the wind?

Fields.MenuText: Anyways, which way are we headed?
How many battles do you think are ahead of us?
What's next on our agenda?

Fields.DialogueText: HQ is sending us further out into the open water.
We've got a long fight, Captain.
HQ's ordered us to transit to a new patrol area to assess and engage Morganas there.
Thanks, Narwhal.
You know, Captain, we should be crossing paths with my pen pal soon. We're finally going to meet!
Going to be ready for them, Narwhal?
I really want to prove to you that this is a real person, and their feelings are legitimate!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
And if not... well, it was fun while it lasted.
Well, no matter what happens, I'm your captain and I'll support you.
Thanks, Captain. Love comes and goes... but fishing is forever!
Let's just hope the Morganas don't scare them both away...
Come to join me in the welcome?
You've been pretty calm these past few days. I'd have thought you'd be bouncing off the walls.
Just trying to temper my expectations. It'd be awkward to smother someone the first time you met them, right?
Assuming there's a "them" in the first place.
Yes, yes, I've been over that. I think that's them now!

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure that's not a Morgana?
Well, I suppose you're finally getting what you want.
I hope it works out, Narwhal.

Fields.DialogueText: Definitely not a Morgana!
It is what I want. I'm even bringing this jewelry for them!
Thank you, Captain. You know how much this means to me.
Good luck, all right?
I can't hear you! I'm already signaling the boat!
*ALARM*
No courtship like blowing up a Morgana, is there?
Hurry, Captain! We didn't come all this way just to lose them now!
@BATTLE
How did it go, Narwhal?
Sigh...
Narwhal?
You were right, Captain. They weren't real. It was just some bored post officer aboard a ship, with nothing better to do...

Fields.MenuText: Wait, so they didn't even care?
I warned you, Narwhal. I'm sorry.
Oh, but you seemed so happy writing your letters...

Fields.DialogueText: I think they did... in theory. But writing about something and confronting it for real are two different things.
I am too, Captain. I thought for sure it might have been love...
Well, I'm definitely not going to write any more.
And to think that I even made him this!
That's some nice jewelry. You shouldn't let it go to waste.
Grrr... I just don't want to think about it anymore.
Why don't I hold onto it for now?
Sure, just take it. Like I care.
But Narwhal, you do care. It wouldn't have felt like such a letdown otherwise.
I just feel so foolish.
*ALARM*
Maybe... a little fishing?
@BATTLE
For falling in love? Don't. You said yourself it was fun while it lasted. Maybe you'll find something that lasts longer.
Well... I see a lot of Morganas exploding in my future. That takes the edge off.
Goodness. Maybe fortune telling, too.
I'm certainly doing less writing these days. That sounds like an excellent idea!
Narwhal, you still hanging in there?
Yeah. I think so.

Fields.MenuText: Don't give up, Narwhal. You're better than disappointments like that.
Narwhal, these things happen to everyone. Don't think that you're the first one on the bad end of a prank.
You'll be better in no time, Narwhal. We'll forget this even happened.

Fields.DialogueText: You know what, you're right. I am better than him!
I wouldn't even call it a prank. Just a misunderstanding. Even if it is a big one.
I know, Captain. It's just going to take time.
I just wish we were in better waters for fishing.
We don't have to fish to spend time together and talk, you know.
Right, but I can't cook conversation. No matter how good it is.
Well, not with that attitude!
If anyone can figure out how, it's you.
One of these days, Captain! Let's practice on some Morganas...
@BATTLE
Narwhal! Look what I've got.
Fishing rods! Are those for me?
Two. They're for us.
Captain, thank you. This means so much to me.

Fields.MenuText: So, which one do you want as yours?
When do we want to try them out?
Are you feeling better?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I do like this nice blue one.
Right away!
Not a hundred percent, but closer to it than zero. Yeah, Captain, I am.
Well, then, I await your command!
Captain, you really do know how to cheer me up.
*ALARM*
Are you ready, Narwhal?
Yeah. I'm ready! Let's hurry through this -  I've been craving seafood!
@BATTLE
Ready for some cooking, Captain?
@BATTLE
So I've been thinking...  This whole incident with my no-good lying pen pal could make a great radio drama!
... What? That's really what's on your mind?
Yeah, why?

Fields.MenuText: You'd need to spice it up a bit.
Have you ever even listened to a radio drama before?
Nothing, Narwhal. I'm just glad you're back to the old you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, yeah, it's a good idea, right? Just needs some refining. Maybe it should be the Morganas sending the letters...
Umm, once, I think. I'm a fan of the adventure serials, actually.
Well, I couldn't have done it without you, Captain!
Regardless, I think it's a good idea. I'd even sell my fishing rod for a radio.
Don't do that! We're going to get a fish soon.
Well, I haven't gotten anything yet, so this pole may be a dud.
What have we learned? Stay positive, right!
Hey, Narwhal, your line! It's moving!
Oh, wow! I think it's a big one!
Nice cast, Narwhal.
Thanks! These fishing rods are great.
Glad you like 'em.
In the middle of a fight?
We might get lucky and hit a shark or something!
At least that'd save us some steps...
So, Captain, are we going to cook that fish for tonight?
Well, it's quite small, so I figured we'd just toss it back!
What? No, you didn't! That was my codfish, fair and square!

Fields.MenuText: Look who's the jokester now.
Ah, all right, you got me. It's over there in the net.
You don't really want to eat it, do you?

Fields.DialogueText: Very funny, Captain. Very funny.
I suppose it does look rather small from here, huh...
Well, I mean... that's what you do when you catch a fish, right?
You know, we've been through a lot together. Morganas had a lot of chances to take us down, but here we are.
Wait, Captain! What are you wearing?
Huh? Just my regular uniform.
No, that! You're wearing the jewelry I made. That's the one I made for...
Well, I didn't want it to go to waste. It's beautifully made.
You know what, Captain? I think it looks better on you than it would have ever looked on that phony.
Thank you, Narwhal. When do you want to go fishing next? We can catch the big one for real.
One thing at a time, Captain. Let's get dinner out of the way. You know, you're not such a bad catch yourself.
It helps that you know who I am.
Quiet, you!
*ALARM*
I do know who you are, Captain. You're there for me even when I'm being a little silly.
Sometimes a little silliness gets us through the hard times. The Morganas wish they could be silly.
And I wish they'd just go away. But you... you can stay.
I'd love to.
